result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas E King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Contrary to Injunction, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 8.17.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 8.17.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-16-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas E King in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Client brought the requested documentation from last date to court.  Court did not amend bail, but ordered the defendant to receive mental health treatment, and follow all conditions of bail.  Case remains calendared for scheduling conference in Branch 15 on 06/06/2014.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Thomas E King in court with attorney Eric M Vega.  Defendant Thomas E King in custody.  Denis Stingl for Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE. Court orders the defendant to bring documentation (stated on the record) to next court date.  Court CANCELS the REMAND.  All conditions of bail remain.  Case is adjourned for bail review in Branch 15.
  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas E King & Justice Point worker Elise Josephson in court. 
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Case in court for Justice Point violation: Positive drug test.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Thomas E King in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/13/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Thomas E King in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Defendant Thomas E King in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
